author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Bhartiya Janata Party (BJP) has interviewed more than 150 candidates who had applied for party ticket to contest from 16 Assembly constituencies in Ramanathapuram, Sivaganga and Pudukottai districts in the May 16 elections.

In all, 168 party volunteers and office-bearers had applied for ticket and almost all of them turned up for the interview conducted here on Sunday, K. Maruleedharan, Ramanathapuram BJP district president, said.

A panel, headed by R. Karuppu Muruganandam, State vice-president, interviewed the candidates, he said, adding the aspiring candidates were asked about the party’s prospects if the party went alone, the background of the candidates and their contributions to the party’s development in the State.

Party members had also applied for State president Tamizhisai Soundararajan and State secretary Vanathi Srinivasan to contest from Ramanathapuram, and senior leaders Suba Nagarajan and D. Kuppuramu to contest from Tiruvadanai Assembly segments, he said.
title: 150 BJP aspirants interviewed
